analysisClass.name: Parameter identifiability (table)
analysisClass.description: Parameter identifiability which uses tables as input.

analysisClass.name: Parameter identifiability (optimization)
analysisClass.description: Parameter identifiability which uses optimization as input.

doc.description: Functions for the optimization analysis. Available optimization methods: Evolution strategy (SRES), Cellular genetic algorithm, Particle swarm optimization, GLBSOLVE, Adaptive simulated annealing

argument.name: settings
argument.description: the optimization settings.

returns.description: created Optimization on success or null otherwise.

argument.name: name
argument.description: the optimization name. If the optimization with the same name was earlier created, it will be rewrited.

argument.name: databaseName
argument.description: the name of the database where the diagram which parameters you want to estimate is stored.

argument.name: diagramName
argument.description: the name of the diagram which parameters you want to estimate.

argument.name: optimizationMethod
argument.description: the identifier of an optimization method. Valid methods are 0 - Adaptive simulated annealing, 1 - Cellular genetic algorithm, 2 - Evolution strategy (SRES), 3 - GLBSOLVE algorithm, 4 - Particle swarm optimization, 5 - Quadratic Hill-climbing.

returns.description: created Optimization on success or null otherwise.

function.name: addExperiment
function.description: Adds an experiment to the optimization document.

argument.name: optimization
argument.description: the optimization document.

argument.name: settings
argument.description: the optimization experiment settings.

function.name: addExperiment
function.description: Adds an experiment to the optimization document.

argument.name: optimization
argument.description: the optimization document to which you want to add the experiment.

argument.name: name
argument.description: the optimization experiment name (must be unique).

argument.name: diagramState
argument.description: the diagram state name, which is specified when you need to fit parameters of the diagram modification identified by state. If the value is equal to the empty string the fitting is performed for the diagram without changes.

argument.name: dataFile
argument.description: the name of the file with experimental data. The data must be stored in folder BioUML\data_resources\Optimization\Experiments.

argument.name: weightMethod
argument.description: the weight method to make all trajectories of each variable have similar importance in the fit. Valid methods are 0 - mean, 1 - mean square and 2 - standard deviation.

argument.name: experimentType
argument.description: the type of experimental data. Valid values are 0 - time course and 1 - steady state.

argument.name: cellLine
argument.description: the parameter for separation of the experiments on the groups. All the fitting parameters declared as local remain global within the same cell line. For the experiments where cell line value is the empty string all local parameters are independently fitted.

argument.name: parameterConections
argument.description: the array of connections between diagram variables and columns of the experimental data table.

function.name: createParameterConnection
function.description: Specifies connections between variables in diagrams and columns in experimental data tables stored in the files.

argument.name: tableColumn
argument.description: the experimental table column.

argument.name: diagramVariable
argument.description: the diagram parameter or variable.

argument.name: dataType
argument.description: the type of the experimental data column. Valid values are 0 - exact value, 1 - relative to initial value and 2 - relative to completion value.

returns.description: created ParameterConection on success or null otherwise.

function.name: addFittingParameter
function.description: Adds a fitting parameter to the optimization document.

argument.name: optimization
argument.description: the optimization document to which you want to add the fitting parameter.

argument.name: var
argument.description: the diagram parameter or variable which you want to fit.

argument.name: lowerBound
argument.description: the lower bound of the parameter search space.

argument.name: upperBound
argument.description: the upper bound of the parameter search space.

argument.name: isLocal
argument.description: the field that determines whether the parameter is local or global for the optimization experiments.

function.name: addConstraint
function.description: Creates constraints on the diagram parameters and variables.

argument.name: optimization
argument.description: the optimization document to which you want to add the constraint.

argument.name: formula
argument.description: the equality or inequality written using the identifiers of parameters and variables declared in the diagram.

argument.name: startTime
argument.description: the start time of the constraint.

argument.name: endTime
argument.description: the end time of the constraint.

function.name: setSimulationParameters
function.description: Set simulation parameters for the specified optimization experiment.

argument.name: optimization
argument.description: the optimization document.

argument.name: expName
argument.description: the name of the optimization experiment.

argument.name: startTime
argument.description: the start time of the diagram simulation.

argument.name: endTime
argument.description: the end time of the diagram simulation.

argument.name: timeIncrement
argument.description: the time increment of the diagram simulation.

function.name: optimize
function.description: Performs the optimization of the diagram parameters and variables based on the experimental data with additional constraints.

argument.name: optimization
argument.description: the optimization document with specified parameters to fit, experimental data and constraints.

returns.description: generated OptimizationResultCollection on success or null otherwise.

property.name: ShortDescription
property.value: Starts a new optimization with the selected method

property.name: LongDescription
property.value: Starts a new optimization with the selected method
